education_text.0: During his career, Fredkin was a professor of computer science at the      Massachusetts Institute of Technology Massachusetts Institute of Technology, a Fairchild Distinguished Scholar at      redirect    Caltech, a  distinguished career professor at      Carnegie Mellon University Carnegie Mellon University, and a Research Professor of Physics at      Boston University Boston UniversityDuring his career, Fredkin was a professor of computer science at the      Massachusetts Institute of Technology Massachusetts Institute of Technology, a Fairchild Distinguished Scholar at      redirect    Caltech, a  distinguished career professor at      Carnegie Mellon University Carnegie Mellon University, and a Research Professor of Physics at      Boston University Boston UniversityDuring his career, Fredkin was a professor of computer science at the      Massachusetts Institute of Technology Massachusetts Institute of Technology, a Fairchild Distinguished Scholar at      redirect    Caltech, a  distinguished career professor at      Carnegie Mellon University Carnegie Mellon University, and a Research Professor of Physics at      Boston University Boston UniversityFredkin worked with a number of companies in the computer field and held academic positions at a number of universitiesIn 1968, Fredkin returned to academia, starting at the      Massachusetts Institute of Technology Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) as a full professor despite the fact that he had never graduated from collegeFredkin had formal and informal associations with      Carnegie Mellon University Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) over several decadesIn 1984, Fredkin was awarded the      Carnegie Mellon University Carnegie Mellon University
